description: From Middle French mémorable, from Latin memorābilis, from memorō (“to bring to remembrance”), from memor (“mindful, remembering”). See memory, and compare memorabilia.

adjectives.description: memorable (comparative more memorable, superlative most memorable)

entries.meaning: Worthy to be remembered; very important or remarkable.
examples: Men have surviving Fame to gain, By Tombs, by Books, by memorable Deeds

entries.meaning: Something interesting enough to be remembered.
examples: These were all the memorables of our visit to Dumbarton Castle, which is a most interesting spot, and connected with a long series of historical events.
